questions.question_text:
Sales Operations at Universal Containers (UC) has created Public Report and Dashboard folders for sales managers that report to the VP of Sales. Sales Operations currently spends a few hours each month updating users that should have access to edit items in these folders.
In which two ways can UC grant access to sales managers to automate access to these Reports and Dashboards folders? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B & C are correct. 
B - sharing up through the hierarchy applies to report & dashboard folders. 
C - public groups is a good strategy as well as you can add users to the group once and then set all of the report folders to share with the group. 

A is incorrect because it grants edit access to the users under the managers, which is not desired. 
D is incorrect as report & dashboard folders cannot be shared with queues. 

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.rd_folders_share_enhanced.htm&type=5
I cannot find a link for the hierarchy sharing on specifically report folders, but sharing for record access is expected. 
https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/approval-process-in-salesforce-scheduler/set-up-role-hierarchy-and-sharing-rules

choices.B: Put the code in an inner class that uses the With Sharing keyword.
choices.D: Add With Sharing keyword to the class.
choices.C: Use the ISUpdatetable() Apex method to test each field prior to allowing update.
choices.A: Use the WITH SECURITY_ENFORCED keyword in the SOQL statement.

discussion.content: the answer should be C, as a SOQL with WITH SECURITY_ENFORCED will still execute correctly and verifies Read access for Field and Object, not Edit access.

Selected Answer: C
Should be C. The isUpdatetable allow to control access in edition of a field, while the A will trigger an error only if the field is not visible to the user
A and C both are the ways to achieve this. With C, we can have graceful handling of access error while with A, it throws an exception causing any further transaction termination.

isUpdateable can be used on fields to check if a user has edit/update access to that field.

WITH SECURITY_ENFORCED is just for soql retrieving records & with sharing keywords have to do with record level access and not field or object level access.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) has a custom Apex class that enforces a business process and updates opportunities. UC has noticed that fields with field-level security permission of read only on certain users’ profiles are being updates by this class.
How should the architect fix this problem?

Universal Containers is planning to pilot a new application to a small set of Sales Reps.
What is the optimal way to grant only those Sales Reps access to the new functionality, while hiding the legacy functionality?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Should be A. Option B, "Revoke access to legacy functions in the Sales Rep profile and create a permission set for the new functionality." would mean the functionality would change for the other sales reps too, but we want to only limit the changes to a small subset of Sales Reps.

choices.A: Clone the Sales Rep profile, adjust settings, and assign the pilot users the new profile.
choices.D: Create a permission set to grant access to the new functionality and hide the old functionality.
choices.B: Revoke access to legacy functions in the Sales Rep profile and create a permission set for the new functionality.
choices.C: Create new user records for the pilot user that they will use for the pilot.
